docs.title: Expectation
docs.text: The functional requirements as described by the customer.

docs.title: Idea
docs.text: Raw description of a specific part of the customer's product or service, exactly as stated by the customer.

docs.title: Wish
docs.text: Description of the customer's proposal of a product or service.

docs.title: Sketch filter
docs.text: The [[Idea filter process]] of advising the customer on their idea in regard to feasibility.

docs.title: Sketch
docs.text: Rough description of an Idea, written by the middle man. Must contain a priority or time estimate, preferably both. Just enough information to be able to set priority and time estimate, no more.

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text: A high level projection of the planned Versions.

docs.title: Version
docs.text: Set of Sketches, chosen based on priority and time cost up to a max. version duration (TBD).

docs.title: Task list
docs.text: Set of low level tasks that satisfy high level requirements/acceptance tests derived from a Technical document. Also know as Features.

docs.title: Technical document
docs.text: The translated Sketch as discussed in detail to form high level requirements/acceptance tests with the middle man.

docs.title: Feature review
docs.text: Post Features development quality assurance and testing from the customer's perspective.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: To be developed by the team. Custom development process per department.

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text: Customer feedback on Features is to be processed in the Wish phase.

docs.title: Presentation phase
docs.text: The Version Features are production ready and can be presented to the customer.
